Offshore Installation Manager Job at Uniterm Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    

Uniterm Nigeria Limited was incorporated in 2004. It has grown rapidly with professional staff of about 200 delivering quality and cost effective services in the Oil & Gas sector of the Nigerian economy. Uniterm is a Nigerian Company owned by Nigerians. The workforce is made up of professionals drawn across the world.

Uniterm is under the management of highly technical personnel with combined experience level of 150 years. Uniterm is a member of International Association of Drilling Contractors (IADC) and the management staff are members of various professional bodies around the world. Uniterm has offices in Portharcourt and Lagos Nigeria, Houston in USA and Calgary in Canada. Uniterm has key Technical Partners in order to continue to use state-of-the-art technology to deliver services.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Offshore Installation Manager

Job Location: Rivers

Job Summary 


	The OIM is in overall charge of and is accountable and responsible for the safety of all persons on-board, equipment and rig and all activities conducted.
	The OIM has total jurisdiction and authority over rig management including but not limited to safety, operations, personnel, training, regulatory compliance, budget management and environmental compliance.


Roles and Responsibilities


	Reports directly and provides support to the Rig Manager with regard the day-to-day management and long-range stewardship of the rig.
	Directly responsible and accountable for the safe and efficient operation and management of the rig and to ensure all drilling operations are conducted in accordance with Client’s well program and Company policies and procedures.
	Demonstrate a personal commitment to Borr Drilling’s QHSE Management System; ensure all personnel on-board comply with Safe Systems of Work (SSOW),i.e. Risk Assessments etc. and act as ultimate approval authority for same.
	Ensure the integrity and stability of the rig is always being maintained while afloat.
	Ensure emergency drills are always conducted and ensure preparedness of crew and equipment.
	Provide comprehensive handover notes for relief and ensure subordinates provide the same.


Qualifications and Experience


	The Offshore Installation Manager shall have a minimum, a High School or similar education with a minimum of 10 years oilfield experience. Specifically, we require individuals who have 5 years of experience in the role of Offshore Installation Manager onboard an offshore installation.
	Candidates must hold their Offshore Survival (OPITO BOSIET/FOET), Offshore Medical (OEUK) and IWCF / IADC Well Control Level 4.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: jobs@unitermintl.com  and stakeholder.recruitment@ncdmb.gov.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Accountant",
  "description": "Sewa Assets Management Limited is an assets management and finance consultancy firm positioned to meet the ever-changing demands and requirements of our clients in the 21st century.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant

Job Location:&nbsp;Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type:&nbsp;Full-time

Summary


	We are a supermarket of fintech companies seeking a detail-oriented and experienced Accountant to join our finance team.
	The Accountant will be responsible for managing financial transactions, from fixed assets to revenue, and ensuring compliance with accounting principles and company policies.&nbsp;
	This role requires strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work independently and as part of a team.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage all accounting transactions for the group.
	Prepare budget forecasts.
	Publish financial statements in time.
	Handle monthly, quarterly and annual closings.
	Reconcile accounts payable and receivable.
